content.rendered:
I’m not sure Rolf understands what Christmas is, but he sat on Benjamin’s lap, and I overheard him saying what he wanted. Rolf wants:

  1. a video camera.
  2. a hug.
  3. a bus ticket to Cuba.
  4. a poodle (friend).
  5. peace on earth.
  6. someone to clean the fish tank.
  7. to be home for Christmas.

I can understand that last one. “I’ll Be Home for Christmas” is one of my favorite songs and I can sing it (more or less) any time of the year. Jesus promises that, one day, I will be home — with him — as part of the bride of Christ.

Now, I can’t say that I understand everything about Jesus, or his love for me. But I accept his love by faith. And I believe that his shed blood was enough to pay my sin debt. What do I want for Christmas? To be with my Jesus, and to finally understand his love.
